summary: This document is an email chain from 2019-2024 regarding a victim's attempts to provide a victim impact statement and receive victim services in the Epstein case. It shows communication between a victim and an FBI victim specialist, with the victim expressing frustration about lack of follow-up and seeking information about therapy options and interviews.

events.title: Victim Follow-up on Services
events.description: A victim emails an FBI victim specialist to inquire about their assigned victim specialist, available therapy options, and whether the government still plans to interview them, noting they now have visas to travel.

events.title: Victim Checks on Email Response
events.description: The victim sends a follow-up email to the FBI victim specialist checking if their previous email about victim services was received and asking for any news from the government.

events.title: Victim Questions Missing Impact Statement
events.description: The victim sends an email following up on a message from five years prior, asking why their victim impact statement regarding the Epstein case was never taken.

keyFacts: A victim of the Epstein case was attempting to provide a victim impact statement and receive victim services as of 2019.
The victim had obtained visas to travel for a potential government interview regarding the case.
The victim was informed about therapy options being offered to victims by the government.
As of October 2024, the victim was still seeking answers as to why their victim impact statement was never taken, indicating a potential lapse in victim outreach or follow-up.
